channel.title: Kobe on Nii's Travel Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Kobe on Nii's Travel Blog

item.title: Japan-Korea Day 4 - Kobe
item.description: Homestay Masterchef Steph learnt to cook some tamagoyaki today! The host mother was happy to teach. I think it turned out okay, it tasted good. But then again, eggs are always da best! Those mini sausages were also very tasty! Kobe City Today we decided to go ahead and explore the city in Kobe. It was HOT! Not hot hot, but sticky, humid hot. We don’t know why everyone was complaining that yesterday was hot, when it was miserable, raining and cool.

item.title: Japan-Korea Day 3 - Himeji Castle
item.description: First day in Kobe …which didn’t actually have anything to do with Kobe Step 1. Find some suitable clothing It has been overcast and raining pretty much non-stop since we got here. This was never the plan really, as Steph only packed 8kg full of short shorts, tank-tops, and thin blouses. Everyone else in Himeji is walking around in jeans, jackets, raincoats and boots, so she felt really out of place.
